title: After Maduro’s Ouster, Marco Rubio Faces the Challenge of Running Venezuela
summary: The secretary of state helped steer President Trump to attacking Venezuela and seizing Nicolás Maduro, and now aims to force the country to give U.S. companies access to its oil.

title: Rubio Tells Lawmakers Trump Wants to Buy Greenland
summary: President Trump has said since his first term that he wants to acquire Greenland, and he asked aides for an updated plan on Monday. European leaders reject the president’s assertions.

title: How Venezuela’s Oil Could Shake Up the World Supply
summary: The country could, eventually, attract investment and re-emerge as a force in the oil markets, but many analysts are concerned about an oversupply.

title: Justice Dept. Memo Approved Military Incursion Into Venezuela as Lawful
summary: The specifics of the memo are unclear. But Attorney General Pam Bondi told lawmakers in briefings this week that the administration would share the document with them.

title: Trump Warns of Impeachment if Republicans Lose Midterm Elections
summary: President Trump is still sowing doubt about the integrity of America’s elections. The claims could affect this year’s midterms.

title: Tim Walz Says He Ended Minnesota Governor Run to Shield Residents From Trump
summary: “I don’t think any governor in history has had to fight a war against the federal government every single day,” Gov. Walz said after ending his re-election bid.

title: Doug LaMalfa’s Death Further Depletes House G.O.P. Majority
summary: The California Republican’s sudden passing, on the same day that Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene’s resignation took effect, made the party’s House math even trickier.

title: Georgia Schedules Special Election for Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Seat
summary: The election on March 10, or a runoff in April, will determine who serves out the remainder of Ms. Greene’s term after her unexpected resignation from Congress.

title: Aldrich Ames, C.I.A. Turncoat Who Helped the Soviets, Dies at 84
summary: As chief of the counterintelligence branch of the C.I.A.’s Soviet division, he had access to some of the nation’s deepest secrets. He had been serving life without parole since 1994.

title: Can You Optimize Love?
summary: A group of tech executives, app developers and Silicon Valley philosophers is seeking to streamline the messy matters of the heart.

title: Israel Tells Doctors Without Borders to End Its Work in Gaza
summary: The move against the medical aid group enforces policies limiting criticism of Israel’s conduct in the war and requiring personal details about Gazan employees.

title: Why Israel Is Divided Over How to Investigate Oct. 7 Failures
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has proposed a commission with members chosen in a way that departs from existing law.

title: Optimism About Nuclear Energy Is Rising Again. Will It Last?
summary: Companies like Kairos Power are building new types of reactors with the encouragement of the Trump administration, but their success is far from assured.

title: Suspect in Brown and M.I.T. Killings Discussed Attacks in Videos, Officials Say
summary: Claudio Neves Valente, who is accused of killing two students at Brown and an M.I.T. professor, left rambling descriptions of the shootings.

title: Murders in New York City Fell 20% in 2025, Though Reported Rapes Rose
summary: Police Commissioner Jessica Tisch and Mayor Zohran Mamdani announced the numbers on Tuesday. Officials attributed the rise in rapes in part to a change in the state definition of sexual assault.

title: Mamdani Paves ‘The Bump,’ A Troublesome Bike Ramp at the Williamsburg Bridge
summary: The small but symbolic gesture, at the foot of the Williamsburg Bridge, signals more ambitious street redesign plans from the new mayor.

title: Cea Weaver Has Long Been a Firebrand. Mamdani Is Standing by Her.
summary: Ms. Weaver, a longtime tenant advocate who was appointed to a high-profile role in Mayor Zohran Mamdani’s administration, is facing criticism for past comments on homeownership.

title: There Were Good Reasons to Depose Maduro
summary: But taking Venezuela’s oil while leaving the regime in place weren’t among them.

title: Trump Is Falling for a Trap We Could All See Coming
summary: Trump’s increasing belligerence abroad should raise alarm about more than the fate of Venezuela.

title: Venezuelan Leaders Project Independence
summary: Also, Europe discusses postwar plans for Ukraine. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Rosa von Praunheim, 83, Dies; Captured Gay Life in Germany on Film
summary: His first feature-length movie, in 1971, was called his country’s “Stonewall moment,” for jump-starting a gay-rights movement. He became a leading voice of it.

title: American Federation of Teachers Sues Texas Over Educators’ Comments on Charlie Kirk
summary: The lawsuit challenges a conservative effort to punish those who criticized Mr. Kirk in the aftermath of his killing.

title: European Allies Agree to Key Security Provisions for Ukraine
summary: Britain and France firmed up a postwar troop commitment in Ukraine, though Russia has said it will reject any deal that allows NATO-country forces in Ukraine.

title: Judge Orders Halligan, a Trump Loyalist, to Explain Why She Has Kept U.S. Attorney Title
summary: The ruling was the most robust effort to date to press the prosecutor, Lindsey Halligan, on why she has continued to serve as the U.S. attorney, despite an order throwing out her appointment.
